title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 ยง 59.4 - Filing and approval requirements for certificates subject to approval under section 3201(b)(1) of the insurance law, other than those mentioned in section 59.3 of this part
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 ยง 59.4 - Filing and approval requirements for certificates subject to approval under section 3201(b)(1) of the insurance law, other than those mentioned in section 59.3 of this part

State Regulations
(a) Certificates subject to this section shall afford insureds protections substantially similar to those provided by group policies and certificates delivered in New York which comply with all group laws, regulations and rules, except as provided in subdivision (b) of this section. (b) Certificates subject to this Part evidencing coverage under a policy delivered outside of New York to a group not recognized under New York law and regulations must comply with the contract and loss or benefit ratio requirements of individual or group insurance, whichever, in the opinion of the superintendent, affords the certificate holder the greatest protection. Such determination may require an insurer to comply with contract standards on a basis different from the applicable loss or benefit ratio standard. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11

59.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
